insight.title: Late Arrival Risk

status.subtitle: Arrival punctuality risk for the next 0â€“3 hours
status.confidence_reason: Traffic and weather outlook are available; confidence depends on short-term traffic volatility.

insight.summary: Late arrivals may become more frequent due to volatile traffic and/or weather amplification.
implications: Higher probability of customers arriving late, causing table-sequencing friction.
Increased variance in seating times can cause knock-on delays during busy periods.
supported_considerations: Traffic volatility affects punctuality more than steady congestion.
Rain risk can increase both travel friction and unpredictability.

suggested_actions.action: Send a soft check-in message shortly before reservation time
suggested_actions.why: Reduces uncertainty and allows re-sequencing if guests report delays.

suggested_actions.action: Use slightly wider buffers for groups of 5+ when volatility is high
suggested_actions.why: Large groups amplify the operational cost of late arrivals.

suggested_actions.action: Avoid scheduling back-to-back reservation start times during peak
suggested_actions.why: Reduces cascading delays when arrivals cluster or slip.
suggested_actions.tradeoff: May reduce peak throughput, improves experience

insight.outlook: Outlook (0â€“3h): Conditions are likely to remain similar in the near term.
insight.trust_note: This insight is based entirely on external conditions (traffic, weather, timing, location). No internal reservation or customer data is used.
